ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Will you continue hewing houses from the mountains with exultant skill?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You hew dwellings in mountains and exult in that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: carving comfortable houses out of the mountains?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And you carve out dwellings in the mountains, with skill?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you hew out in the mountains, houses with great skill."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And you hew houses out of the mountains exultingly;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Will you still skilfully hew houses out of the mountains?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: hewing out houses in the mountains and taking pride in your skill?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And hew ye out houses in the mountains skilfully! g
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —while you skillfully hew out houses from the mountains?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And ye carve houses out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you carve houses out of mountains with great skill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Will you still hew your dwellings in the mountains?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And you skillfully carve houses in the mountains?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:149] And you hew dwellings out of the mountains arrogantly (a variant reading [of farihīna, ‘arrogant’] has fārihīn, ‘skilfully’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?) it is also said that this means: feeling proud of, and haughty about, your farms.
